original: Holmberg, Gustaf Evald, marindirektör, Karlskrona, f. 8/3/88 i Örebro av fabr. L. G. Holmberg o. Vilhelmina Grönkvist. G. 15 m. Annie Sofia Olson. Barn: Ernst Gustaf f. 16, Anna Brita 21, Märta Kristina 24. — Mog:-ex. 06, ex. v. KTH 10. E. marining. 12, marining. av andra gr. 14, första gr. 18, tjg. v. örlogsvarvet i Karlskrona 18-26, v. örlogsvarvet i Sthlm 26-31 o. 33-36, lär. v. KSS 26-35, kontroll. v. bygg. av statsisbryt. Ymer 31-33, tjg. v. marinförvaltn. 36-39, marin-dir. av andra gr. 37, mob :ing. v. örlogsvarvet i Karlskrona 39-42, marin-dir. av första gr. 42, chef f. ing:dep. i Karlskrona 42-45, verkstadsdir. v. marinverkst. i Karlskrona sed. 45. RNO, RVO, ChrXFrM, LÖS.
translated: Holmberg, Gustaf Evald, naval director, Karlskrona, born March 8, 1888 in Örebro to factory owner L. G. Holmberg and Vilhelmina Grönkvist. Married Annie Sofia Olson in 19xx and had three children: Ernst Gustaf born in 1916, Anna Brita born in 1921, and Märta Kristina born in 1924. Holmberg graduated from the Royal Institute of Technology in 1910, and later became a naval engineer in 1912 and a naval engineer of the second degree in 1914, first degree in 1918. He served at the naval shipyard in Karlskrona from 1918 to 1926, then at the naval shipyard in Stockholm from 1926 to 1931 and 1933 to 1936. He was a teacher at the Royal Swedish Naval Academy from 1926 to 1935 and a control officer overseeing the construction of the state icebreaker Ymer from 1931 to 1933. He served in the naval administration from 1936 to 1939, and was a naval director of the second degree in 1937. He was called up for military mobilization at the naval shipyard in Karlskrona from 1939 to 1942, and was a naval director of the first degree in 1942. He was the head of the engineering department in Karlskrona from 1942 to 1945, and became the managing director of the naval workshop in Karlskrona in 1945. Holmberg received the Order of the North Star, the Order of Vasa, the Order of the Polar Star, and the Litteris et Artibus medal.
